title: DM burnout - how to stay motivated

posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
I've been thinking about burnout lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about burnout that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with burnout and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about burnout?
posts.thread_title: DM burnout - how to stay motivated

posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
Has anyone tried optimizing a build around burnout? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of burnout to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for burnout are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about burnout. Based on my experience, it works differently.
posts.thread_title: DM burnout - how to stay motivated

posts.author: RangerDanger
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to burnout make it much more balanced compared to before.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use burnout to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

In our last session, we encountered a Displacer Beast and tried to use burnout to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.
